intro: Achyrocline crassiceps, commonly known as the thick-headed achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments. Its leaves are usually thick and fleshy, which helps it retain moisture in arid conditions. The flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink.
